Returns SSE stream with progress updates and final result, 
sse event: 

**event list:**

- ip.creation_steps

 ```json
{
  "order": 1,
  "event": "ip.creation_steps",
  "label": "Creation steps",
  "summary": "When started a creation process, this event will return the creation steps in `data` structure.",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.data_validating

 ```json
{
  "order": 2,
  "event": "ip.data_validating",
  "label": "Data verification",
  "summary": "Validating IP creation data.",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.asset_to_ipfs

 ```json
{
  "order": 3,
  "event": "ip.asset_to_ipfs",
  "label": "Asset to IPFS",
  "summary": "Uploading IP asset to IPFS, at current step, the data in `data` is the progress of asset uploading",
  "is_progress": true,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.token_creating

 ```json
{
  "order": 14,
  "event": "ip.token_creating",
  "label": "Creating IP Token",
  "summary": "Creating IP token, this may take a while depends on the network condition",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.token_creating_reward_pool

 ```json
{
  "order": 15,
  "event": "ip.token_creating_reward_pool",
  "label": "Creating Reward Pool",
  "summary": "Creating reward pool for IP token.",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.start_launch_agent.starting

 ```json
{
  "order": 116,
  "event": "ip.start_launch_agent.starting",
  "label": "IP Token Run Strategy",
  "summary": "Starting to run strategy for IP token if your purchase strategy is `agent`",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.start_launch_agent.calculate_cost

 ```json
{
  "order": 118,
  "event": "ip.start_launch_agent.calculate_cost",
  "label": "Calculate Cost for Purchase Strategy",
  "summary": "Calculating cost for purchase strategy, if your strategy is `agent`",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.start_launch_agent.check_balance

 ```json
{
  "order": 119,
  "event": "ip.start_launch_agent.check_balance",
  "label": "Check Balance for Purchase Strategy",
  "summary": "Checking balance for IP strategy, if your strategy is `agent`",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.start_launch_agent.swap_sol

 ```json
{
  "order": 120,
  "event": "ip.start_launch_agent.swap_sol",
  "label": "Swap SOL for Purchase Strategy",
  "summary": "Swapping SOL for IP strategy, if your strategy is `agent`",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.start_launch_agent.transfer_sol

 ```json
{
  "order": 121,
  "event": "ip.start_launch_agent.transfer_sol",
  "label": "Transfer SOL for Purchase Strategy",
  "summary": "Transferring SOL for IP strategy, if your strategy is `agent`",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.start_launch_agent.transfer_usdc

 ```json
{
  "order": 122,
  "event": "ip.start_launch_agent.transfer_usdc",
  "label": "Transfer USDC for Purchase Strategy",
  "summary": "Transferring USDC for IP strategy, if your strategy is `agent`",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.start_launch_agent.start_agent

 ```json
{
  "order": 123,
  "event": "ip.start_launch_agent.start_agent",
  "label": "Start Purchase Strategy Agent",
  "summary": "Starting purchase strategy, if your strategy is `agent`",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```
- ip.start_launch_agent.agent_started

 ```json
{
  "order": 124,
  "event": "ip.start_launch_agent.agent_started",
  "label": "Purchase Strategy Agent Started",
  "summary": "Purchase strategy agent started, if your strategy is `agent`",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": true
}
```
- ip.token_created_on_chain

 ```json
{
  "order": 1007,
  "event": "ip.token_created_on_chain",
  "label": "IP Token Created On Chain",
  "summary": "IP token is created successfully, this event will be triggered when the IP token is created successfully, and the data in `data` is the IP info.",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": true
}
```
- ip.warning

 ```json
{
  "order": 1008,
  "event": "ip.warning",
  "label": "IP Warning",
  "summary": "IP warning, `data` is the warning info.",
  "is_progress": false,
  "is_completed": false
}
```

**error event:**

if error occurs, the event will be `error` and the data in `data` is the error message, sse will be closed.
Launch static token for an ip, the token will be allocated to the given addresses with the given amounts. and no bonding curve. only allow developer to launch static token.

Delegate an ip token to a market maker

info.title: Giggle.Pro Developer API Reference
info.description:
# Introduction

The Giggle API provides essential services for digital identity and financial management for widget developers and all personal users to create their own IP libraries:

- **IP Management**: IP library management, including creation, retrieval, and interaction with IP data
- **Account Management**: User login, profile management, and activity tracking, following/unfollowing other users
- **Wallet Functions**: Secure digital wallet management, balance query, and send/receive tokens
- **Payment Processing(coming soon)**: Support user wallet payment with secure transaction handling

---

# Authentication

Most protected endpoints require a valid JWT token in the Authorization header. 
Public endpoints can be accessed without authentication. Each endpoint in the documentation is clearly marked to indicate whether authentication is required. To obtain a JWT token for accessing protected endpoints, please refer to our authentication widget documentation at [Widget Authentication](https://docs.giggle.pro/widget-development/authentication-and-security). The widget provides a streamlined authentication flow that handles token generation, refresh, and secure storage for your application.

---

# Response Format

Most responses are in JSON format, the main schema is as follows:

```json
{
    "code": 200,
    "msg": "some message",
    "data": {}
}
 ```

---

# Error Response

If request fails, api will will return http error code and the error response in the following format:

```json
{
    "code": 400,
    "msg": "this is an error message",
    "data": {}
}
 ```

error codes examples:

- 400: Bad Request
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: Forbidden
- 404: Not Found
- 500: Internal Server Error

---

# Event Stream Response

Some endpoints return event stream response (SSE),   the response will be in the following format:

```json
{
    "event": "some event",
    "data": {}
}
```

This approach is particularly used for long-running operations such as IP creation, token publishing, and other time-intensive processes that require real-time progress updates to the client.

To see how to process the event stream response, please refer to the [Event Stream](https://docs.giggle.pro/widget-development/event-stream-response) documentation.

---

user_id.description: The user id of the invited by

username.description: The username of the invited by

avatar.description: The avatar of the invited by

email.description: The email of the invited by

link_pic.description: The og-picture url of the link

invited_by.description: The invited by of the register info

type.description: The type of the register info

source_link_summary.description: The source link summary of the register info

source_link.description: The source link of the register info

app_id.description: The app id of the register info

from_widget_tag.description: The widget tag of the register info

user.description: user of the user to follow
user of the user to follow

price.description: current price of the ip token

market_cap.description: market cap of the ip token

circulating_supply.description: circulating supply of the ip token

total_supply.description: total supply of the ip token

cover_url.description: cover url of the ip token

file_url.description: file url of the ip token

visitLink.description: visit link of the ip token

metadata_uri.description: metadata uri of the ip token

sequels_amount.description: sequels amount of the ip token

credit_price.description: credit price of the ip token, this field is only used for license purchase

created_at.description: created at of the ip token

updated_at.description: updated at of the ip token

volume.description: trade volume of the ip token

on_exchange.description: on exchange of the ip token

poolAddress.description: pool address of the ip token

tradeUsdcVolume.description: trade usdc volume of the ip token

isStatic.description: is static token of the ip token

availables.description: The available tokens can be claimed

user_id.description: The user id of the invited user

email.description: The email of the invited user

username.description: The username of the invited user

avatar.description: The avatar of the invited user

created_at.description: The created at of the invited user

total.description: The total number of invited users

status.description: status of the trade, 1: pending, 2: success, 3: failed

cover_asset_id.description: The cover image asset id to mint, must be an image asset

video_asset_id.description: The video asset id to mint, if not provided, the nft will be an image nft

name.description: name of the asset, not unique

type.description: type of the asset, all, video, image

category.description: category of the asset, uploads, exports, ip-clips

path.description: path of the asset in s3

path_optimized.description: optimized path of the asset in s3

source_video.description: Source video id, only available for category exports and type video, this indicates the id of the video that was exported to create this asset

asset_info.description: info of the asset, normaly video or image metadata

signed_url.description: signed url of the asset, for browser to access

download_url.description: signed url of the asset, for download

public_url.description: Public url of the asset, this url will be accessible by anyone if you uploaded with public is true, otherwise this value is empty

name.description: name of the asset, not unique

type.description: type of the asset, all, video, image

category.description: category of the asset, uploads, exports, ip-clips

path.description: path of the asset in s3

path_optimized.description: optimized path of the asset in s3

exported_by.description: which product exported this asset, video-2-video or face-swap, etc...

source_video.description: Source video id, only available for category exports and type video, this indicates the id of the video that was exported to create this asset

asset_info.description: info of the asset, normaly video or image metadata

exported_by_task_id.description: task id of the asset, only available for internal use, this indicates the id of the task that was exported to create this asset

is_public.description: Is this asset public, default is false, if true, the asset will be public and can be accessed by anyone.

object_key.description: object key of the asset in s3

signed_url.description: signed url of the asset, for upload, you need use PUT method to upload the asset via this url

address.description: Address of the account, if you setting customized role, you must set this

ratio.description: Ratio of tokens to be allocated to the pool, sum of ratios must be 90

role.description: Role of the account, platform always has 10% of the revenue

allocate_type.description: Type of the allocation, currently we only support usdc, so keep this as usdc

external_ratio.description: External ratio of the limit offer

start_date.description: Start date of the limit offer

end_date.description: End date of the limit offer

current_balance_in_usdc.description: Current balance of the pool in USDC

buyback_burn_ratio.description: Buyback burn ratio of the pool

amount.description: Cost amount of the order, must be integer, 100 means $1.00, min is 1($0.01)

email.description: The user of the cost, when order paid, the cost will be distributed to this user, default is developer
The user email of the ip holder, if not exists, this record will be ignored

allocate_role.description: The allocate role of the ip holder revenue

percent.description: The percent of the ip holder revenue, must be integer, 1 means 100%, min is 1(1%)

order_id.description: The order id, if provided, this parameter is use for avoid duplicate order,if not provided, a new order id will be generated.

amount.description: The amount of the order, only accept integer, 100 means $1.00, min is 1($0.01)

release_rewards_after_paid.description: Release rewards after paid of the order, default is `false`, **NOTE:** order will be **NOT** refundable if rewards are released

buyback_after_paid.description: Buyback after paid of the order, default is `false`,if release_rewards_after_paid set to `true`, the rewards will be released after buyback

allow_free_credit.description: Allow free credit of the order, default is `true`, if set to `false`, the order will not be allowed to use free credit

The costs of the order.

    Can be multiple costs and the total amount of the costs must be less than the 90% of the amount of the order.
    The costs will be distributed to the distribute_wallet provided.

wallet_address.description: Wallet address of the user who will pay the tokens

email.description: email of the user to be airdropped

usd_amount.description: USDC valued amount of tokens, if you want airdrop specific amount of tokens, set this to 0 and provide token_amount.

token_amount.description: Amount of tokens to be airdropped, if you want airdrop USDC valued amount, set this to 0 and provide usd_amount.

lock_days.description: Amount lock days, currently we only support 0 and 180, 0 means release rewards immediately, 180 means 180 days

request_id.description: request id to avoid duplicate airdrop, if not specified, we will generate an uuid, if you specify this, you must ensure the request id is unique

total.description: Total amount of tokens in the pools

total_credit_balance.description: The total credit balance of the user

free_credit_balance.description: The free credit balance of the user

amount.description: The amount of the top up, every 1 credit is 0.01 USDC, minimum 100 credits and must be integer

callback_url.description: The callback url when status changed of top up order

invited_user_id.description: The invited user id of the statement

username.description: The invited user email of the statement

avatar.description: The invited user avatar of the statement

is_free_credit.description: The is free credit of the statement

free_credit_issue_id.description: The free credit issue id of the statement

created_at.description: The created at of the statement

updated_at.description: The updated at of the statement

order_id.description: The order id of the statement

free_credit_invited_user_info.description: If the statement is a free credit issue, the invited user info of the statement, otherwise null

widget_tag.description: The widget tag of the order created by

ip_id.description: The ip id of the order created by

amount.description: The amount of the free credit, minimum 1 and maximum 10000

email.description: Email to receive the free credit

issue_type.description: The issue type of the free credit , default is **widget_direct_issue**
